intro: Rosa alpina f. curtidens, commonly known as the Alpine rose or the alpine rock rose, is a subspecies of the alpine rose native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically oval or elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine climates. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to flourish in challenging environments.
